Answer.answer: I think there's still a lot of growth needed in terms of providing a little pressured working environment. There's a need for more staff.

The high expectations can make me feel like I'm lacking somewhere as it requires me to go beyond measure and sometimes I feel like I'm not delivering or it's not enough and it can be somewhat emotionally draining.
It's an organization that takes care of it's people. They try their most to hear what the rest of the organization has to say so that we can see be happy!
greater together and my manager encouragement
Opportunities for growth and being exposed to a wide range of work.
the sense that we find it difficult to push ahead on important/strategic projects because we are constantly addressing "fires" / reactionary pieces of work
My feedback on our shared goals is that I would like to see a world in which they were all framed for the benefit of the student / delivering on our mission for students.
On Trust and care, communications can change without any explanation or clarity.
I feel left out in many communications involving the school sometimes getting it from 3rd parties. Communication from management is mostly harsh and confrontational rather than supportive.

onboarding should be at own campuses. Onboarding should comprise of the daily expectations at that specific campus. In most campuses a lot of new members felt like they were thrown in the deep end, and there was an assumption that they knew their roles.
Being expected to stay longer when I have no transportation to get home. There is a perception that everyone has cars and lives close to school or can afford to live close.
The culture, support from the school leaders, the constant need to grow from your role and the positive feedback and areas of development after observations. I love it!

Quite honestly, it would depend on the team you are joining at Nova Pioneer. Academic teams are the best, clearly defined structures and systems for planning out a long term career at NP. Central teams not so much - lots of stuff is still up in the air as we try to map out the growth of the org.
Indecision at top level - we take too long to make critical decisions. Using the available pool of data sometimes is all that is needed to make decisions.
The people. They make it worth it.
Transparent is critical to a successful team - lack of it causes mistrust which can be detrimental to team success.
The thing i like the most about the school are the professional development workshops. My manager always goes out of her way to make sure i get all the help and advice i need.
To some extent I can say at the beginning this people tell you more things about Nova but not that way
Treatment of support staff not good
I do not feel financially appreciated
The people I work with are caring, supportive and share the same dream or passion as I do. They are like minded people
The teamwork and the willingness to help shown by most teammates
The long working hours that spill into the weekends
The impact we are having and working within a team that stretches you proffesionally
The people, the vision, the ability to do your best work and be your authentic self without being micro-managed.
We do have quite a lot of meeting which makes it hard to find balance and not work from home.

Care for the teammates' happiness Ability to gauge the students feelings through surveys which then informs the steps required for proper delivery. The endeavour to make teachers better through weekly PDs Teammate management, classroom observations and feedback to teachers.
We are not yet there in proper student supervision, though we are working on it
As it is at NPTB, innovation needs a revamp, something we are taking seriously, and are currently working on introducing a weekend program for it
11hours working time, lack financial support for extra working hours for travel arrangements
The work load doesn't match the renumeration and as inflation hits the school and affects parents, the staff is in a glass house where inflation doesn't hit

Culture is used by some in leadership positions as a way to manipulate others. I.e. they want to pile more work onto your plate, and when you say that you do not have the capacity, they get "offended" and then you are not being "greater together". Leading on from the previous point I do not see the culture values lived out by some people in leadership roles. Thus, these values have become mere empty words for me. There is also very limited scope to grow, and I feel very undervalued.

As stated in point one, the misuse of the culture principles by some in leadership positions. Me taking up an additional role and not having proper resources to execute and feeling that I am merely there to tick a box and nothing more. The way some school leaders treat their staff and almost seem to be untouchable without anything being done about it. As a result Nova is losing good workers and skill that we can ill afford to lose.

Some great leaders, people that I can look up to and that make it work the while for me. Yes, leadership is the one crucial factor that can destroy culture or build it, drive talent away or develop it. I feel extremely strongly about leadership.

These are all trademarks of good leadership. This is also where I think Nova can improve the most. Having said that, again I wish to state that there are some leaders that display most of these trates.

In order to be transparent I would have to share, if asked, that the salary is not competitively high and that we are still in an unpredictable start-up environment in many areas. Not everyone is well suited in personality to such conditions. But I would also tell them that the team is very purpose-driven and fun to work with!
I struggle with having system issues preventing me from doing my work (e.g. internet failures or students not having access to laptops for my class).

I don't really understand the question. Is it asking whether I believe these elements are required for healthy teams? I have assumed so and answered accordingly. But If you're asking whether we do have these things in our teams across NP I would have some different answers.
Dean of Academic and School Operations
Meetings nearly every day of the week.
Global Director Learning and Instructional Design

I can tell we are making many steps in the right direction with prioritizing TVP and teammate happiness. A big part of that will be re-assessing just how much time we are asking of people in order to be considered a successful employee - as it stands now, there is more work to be done than working hours in the day.
A lot of work, not a lot of respect for people's time and contributions. Feels more like a business and less like a school network every day.
Being able to work with children and youth, and changing mindsets around education on the continent.

This questions was tough- for some teams I am on, I feel most of these things. For other teams, not so much. Organizationally though, I do not feel we have much transparency on how decisions are made, leading to teammates feeling they are not getting the whole truth.
Dean of School and Academic Operations

The lack of structures/processes and the fact that we are so slow in implementing these make me less likely to recommend. I love the company and I love being part of the growth and establishing of, but it feels like we are not learning from mistakes and merely repeating the same mistakes over and over.
How hard it is to get stuff done. Lack of accountability.
How much we value work/life balance. How we listen to each other. How much we care for each other.

Although we try to, I do not think the Senior school students/parents have internalised the mission. And that there is a very strong culture of no accountability being fostered towards SS students (they are not taught to be accountable/take responsibility for their own growth and learning).
Consistent engagement with the senior managers
Associate Dean of Instruction and Learning
The support and development of my own growth as a person and my career.Being valued for my contribution.
At times, the amount of information/documents can seem overwhelming especially if they have not been unpacked/explained.
Being part of a dynamic, driven organisation
The no transparency and skin colour promotions. We don't have a balance on that matter.
The high expectations set for a teacher.
My team yes they support me not my manager.
The segregation that other school-based teams face from the Academic Team especially in celebrating student and school success
Living out the culture principles, identifying and improving on failures and celebrating each other every so often.
Encourage other teammates to focus on culture principle to improve away of living in novapioneer
Enjoy been part of the team

I try but always hit a wall when it comes to compensation, out there people believe we earn good salaries given the status of the school and organization, I never know what to say when asked about compensation, I shy away.
It feels like the organization is disconnected with the reality of our challenges as staff, as much as they do listen, i sometimes wonder is it genuine or just to soothe us
i like the students, they are great....the fact that i get to be part of their journey in life makes me realise my purpose, they encourage me to give my best.
we are moving, but standards and quality should be maintained as we move
Constant lack of clarity. Passing the buck (Lack of accountability from managers).Managers that constantly react to something negative and not acknowledge the little effort that is put .
Chinezi makes you believe in the dream. The team I work with.
I do not think Nova Pioneer is for everyone - you need to be very resilient to work here. Not everything is as it seems on the outside.

The inconsistencies especially around job growth (and everything else really) - if you are not a favourite you will not be given an opportunity to grow irrespective of how much you contribute to your team and the impact it has on the organisation. I also feel like a lot of decision at Nova Pioneer are motivated by what race you are in addition to who you know and have relationships with.

I love the vision and the people. Most people at Nova Pioneer are generally here because they believe in the Nova Pioneer promise and a number of our staff send their children here because they believe that they make this place a great place and hence they trust the organisation and their colleagues with the future of their children.
Ensure culture is upheld across all teams, more so school teams.
The budget holds and hiring freeze
Helps me in growing in my career
The Nova culture because it is the driving force.
The growth and the good rapport with colleagues and learners.

Nova Pioneer is a great place to learn and grow for new teachers. The reason for the 6 is that there seems to be a disconnect between the people in the office and teachers, which puts a lot of extra and unnecessary pressure on teachers.
All the extra teacher admin which takes away valuable time to prepare for lessons and support students.
The continues feedback and teacher development. And support from management.
Greater together. Support structure is amazing.
The lack of more sports opportunitites for the learners.
The support structure from my coach and school leader
Associate Manager Global Systems and Analytics
The high calibre of person that I get to work with on a daily basis, the amount I am able to learn from them and how challenged I feel to always be growing.

Often there is this sense of impending doom and that many, if not all tasks are usually super time sensitive. I understand that the work we do is fast-paced and requires one to think on their feet but sometimes it would be nice to step back and take more time on each work piece.
The culture, the people and the mission we are aspiring towards. I also feel a genuine sense of being developed and that the org truly cares about its people.
I am pretty obsessed with my team :) I cannot imagine a group of people who I would get along with better. Our working styles are complementary and I very much enjoy working with them
Meeting our mission is no easy task, I think we are getting there but there is much work to be done :)
Team mates being able to live out the culture principles and working as a team!
It's a place that makes me be able to meet my professional needs

GLOW: Students are engaging, curious and this makes teaching enjoyable. GROW: My opinion, The process of evaluating teachers' performance is not data and facts and some times don't reflect the actual performance.
Process of evaluating and validating teacher performance.
Being in class with the students.
Compensate teammates extra time in school eg during field trip days and during weekend school events.
The shouts, as at times they make those who are not naturally vocal feel demeaned.
Constant and clear communication about meetings, I also love the way principal Christine addresses the members of staff with lots of humility.
Interaction with other teams is not good hence you can greet someone but he or she does not reply because you are in housekeeping and he or she is ateacher or of higher rank than you.
I would kindly urge the operation manager to reach as individually.Thankyou.
Some of our request are not met.
We have aunique way of greeting one another(feast bump)and the six culture principals.
My manager really works hard to support me ,which i feel it adds up value.
majority are living the the nova culture.
It's a fair place to work at and the people genuinely want to be here.

I do think, which is something mentioned previously, that in the competitive nature of Private schools, remuneration does affect the turnover rates annually. I also feel we are overloaded with work, and I'm always tired or feeling tired. Perhaps too much doubling up or overlapping of work
It is a place of growth for me, even though I have been teaching since 2011. It forces us to grow on a daily basis
Nova is a great platform for one to grow in his career life
It's a brand that really motivates one to grow in his/her career
So far so good,it's quite motivating
We as the novanieers we are heading to the goals of achieving and developing in the future
The culture of the work place works with people if people do not want to embrace it then the people view teammates as sticks in the mud.
The respect of the culture principles as working life principles not just theories to read and memorize
The open working space to express and unlock the potential of others and self.
Some small things that need priority are overlooked. An example is property maintenance.
I like that my manager has confidence in my functionality abilities and gives me room to work with minimal supervision while holding me to account.
I think the only difficult part is being assessed by someone who victimizes you and constantly finds fault. You feel demotivated and undermined.
Being assessed by a manager who victimizes and undermines you. As well as, the extra admin, like weekly opportunities etc.
The fun, the learners, the learning design assistance.
I enjoy the team I work with. My apprentice and co-teacher and I get along very well and work well together.
The culture principles are good guidelines for what is expected at the school.
